thunderstorm: Avoid windows, doors, porches, and concrete surfaces.
Seek shelter immediately, even if caught out in the open.
rain: Cover and clean open wounds to reduce chance of infection.
extreme heat: Stay in an air-conditioned place as much as possible.
Limit outdoor activities to when it's coolest, like morning and evening.
Stop all activity if you become lightheaded, confused, weak, or faint.
winter weather: Stay in a warm place indoors.
Conserve heat in your home by closing off unneeded rooms and covering windows and cracks.
Leave all water taps slightly open so they drip continuously.
From time to time, move your arms, legs, fingers, and toes to keep blood circulating.
limited visibility: Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.
While driving, ensure that your low-beam headlights are on.
Avoid using high-beams as they can create glare.
When visibility is extremely limited, pull over to a safe location and wait for conditions to improve.
